htmlText.featureText: This example demonstrates the group functionality of Frinex group experiments. Group experiments are run with multiple participants, each on different computers over the network. As a result to use this example in the normal configuration you will need to run this experiment on multiple computers simultaneously.

In order to make testing a group experiment easier there is a group test page which emulates multiple browsers by using iframes and javascript to predefine a random but shared group and assign group member codes via the URL of each of the experiment instances. This allows up to eight experiment instances (group members) to run simultaneously in one browser window. This group emulation page also contains a robot, that when enabled, randomly presses buttons on each instance causing the experiment to proceed without intervention.
You can see an automated group interaction with the robot group test page.

The group experiments function by the use of a group communication server. The messages from each group member are sent to the group server and then broadcast to all group members. Not all group messages are to be used by all group members. For example if two members are not in the same communication channel, they will not respond to each others messages.
You observe the group messaging functionality in your browser with the group diagnostics page.
This group formation presenter is not strictly needed. However it does allow the group to be set up and its structure checked before proceeding.

The group name has been allocated in the URL. This member will be placed in the group associated with this name. If however the provided member code is already taken then this participant cannot be a member of this group.
The group name has not been provided in the URL and a group will be randomly assigned. A specific group can be assigned by appending &group=X to the URL.
The group member code has been provided in the URL. This participant will be added to a group where the supplied member code is not already taken.
The group member code has not been provided. This member will not be assigned a group without a member code being provided in the URL.
You can specify the member code by adding &member=X to the URL.

The phaseMembers of this groupMemberActivity determines which members see this activity and in which phases.
<groupMemberActivity phaseMembers="A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H:-">

Each phase is separated by a : so "A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H:-" describes two phases. The all participants will see activity in the first phase and no participants will see it in the second phase as indicated by the "-" in the second position.

The GroupFormation presenter has a group of 8 defined by groupMembers="A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H". All of the 8 group members are in the same communication channel as defined by groupCommunicationChannels="A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H". Which causes all members to wait for and potentially see messages from all other members.
<groupNetwork groupMembers="A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H" groupCommunicationChannels="A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H">

The GroupOf4 presenter in contrast has 4 group members defined by groupMembers="A,B,C,D". Each member is in a different communication channel as defined by groupCommunicationChannels="A|B|C|D". Which means that no member waits for nor sees messages from other members.
<groupNetwork groupMembers="A,B,C,D" groupCommunicationChannels="A|B|C|D">

The GroupOf6 presenter has 6 group members defined by groupMembers="A,B,C,D,E,F". Each communication channel contains a pair of members as defined by groupCommunicationChannels="A,B|C,D|E,F". Which means that A and B wait and sees messages from other, as do the other pairs C|D and E|F. While members without a common comunication channel such as A and C do not interact nor wait.
<groupNetwork groupMembers="A,B,C,D,E,F" groupCommunicationChannels="A,B|C,D|E,F">
Participants E, F, G and H are not members of this group and not will be shown any activities here.

In this example, each of the participants A, B, C and D are each in their own communication channel, as defined by groupCommunicationChannels="A|B|C|D" and therefore each of them can proceed without waiting for others.
